knimeNode.name: MDS Pivot
knimeNode.shortDescription: Performs a Classical Multi-Dimensional Scaling (MDS). Objects are placed according to a selected sub-set (pivots) of all dissimilarities.

fullDescription.intro:
Performs a Classical Multi-Dimensional Scaling (MDS). Objects are placed according to a selected sub-set (pivots) of all dissimilarities. For details see
Eigensolver Methods for Progressive Multidimensional Scaling of Large Data published by Brandes and Pich.
fullDescription.option: Select lower dimensionality to embed data into.

If selected, specify the number of pivot rows. These rows are then used to calculate the MDS-embedding on. The remaining rows are mapped corresponding these embedding. Due to performance reasons, it is recommend to set this number, if the number of rows exceed a certain threshold, that is, the similarity matrix of all rows would not fit into memory.
Select number of columns to be embedded into lower dimension.

option.name: Append all column not used for MDS:

fullDescription.option: Appends all columns (numeric and non-numeric) to the resulting lower-dimensional table.
